intro: Richardella manaosensis, commonly known as the Amazonian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows as an erect herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Due to its habitat in humid, tropical environments, it thrives in well-drained, nutrient-rich soils.
